question.title: OpenPDF layout issue
question.body:
Let's jump into the code:

@Override
  public void generateReport() {
    try (final FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream("report_example.pdf")) {
      final Image img = Image.getInstance(header.getContentAsByteArray());
      img.scaleToFit(600, 200);
      img.setAlignment(ALIGN_CENTER);

      final Document document = new Document(
          A4,
          36,
          36,
          0,
          36);

      final PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, fos);
      writer.setPageEvent(new CustomPageEvent());

      document.open();

      //here everything is ok
      document.add(img);
      addAfterTopHeaderParagraph(document);
      addRiskRatingTable(document);
      addRiskRatioParagraph(document);
      addChartPic(document);

      document.newPage();
      //here I am having a small white gap between the top of the page and the image itself
      document.add(img);
      final Font boldFont = FontFactory.getFont(HELVETICA_BOLD, 10);
      document.add(new Paragraph("E-Mail Domain Findings", boldFont));
      addFindingsTable(document);

      document.add(new Paragraph("Website Findings", boldFont));
      addFindingsTable(document);

      document.add(new Paragraph("Credit Card Findings", boldFont));
      addFindingsTable(document);

      document.add(new Paragraph("TypoSquatting Findings", boldFont));
      addFindingsTable(document);

      document.add(new Paragraph("Ip Address Findings", boldFont));
      addFindingsTable(document);

      document.close();
    } catch (Exception e) {

    }
  }

So as you can see from the comment lines on every new page I have these gaps and I don't know how to overcome this issue. Absolute position solves it but all the content I have added to the PDF will appear under the image or on the image, depending on options. Any help will be appreciated!
